data.title: Git diff is not working when VS Code is opened on a sub folder
data.body:
- Open one of the extensions folders in VS Code source using VS Code
- Do some changes in the file
- Open the changed file in SCM view 

- Diff is not correct. See the following pic. Left editor opens Sub folder (Extension) and Right editor opens VS Code main folder. Diff in both are different. Basically left one is wrong and right one is correct.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10746682/22754553/2de52cd6-ee40-11e6-9b04-08e733b06793.png)

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create a new window, size it as desired - mine are large, btw.
2. File > New Window

data.title: Fish shell history completion gets munged
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version:
- OS Version: Mac OSX 10.11.6

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Make `fish` your default shell before opening VS Code
2. Ensure you have a sizable fish command history
3. Open the Integrated Terminal
4. Trigger fish's history search (e.g. by `^r`)
5. Start typing to narrow the results (minimum of 4 chars)
6. Notice how the input area for fish is munged.

example image: 
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/563345/22752037/9a28fa74-edfc-11e6-9067-91b7dfc11516.png)

data.title: search results in a tree view
data.body:
Hi guys,

I'd really like to have an option to see the search results in a tree view. When working on big JS codebases I find it difficult to see the relevant findings in this flattened list, although in many cases when the search result is small, this flattened list is easier for the eye. 
BTW this search panel could be a nice extension point as well, not sure what is an easier thing to do.
I'll try to contribute sometime, but I hope someone would take this ticket soon :)

Thanks guys,
Thomas

PS.: VSCode is awesome, you are awesome, thank you.

data.title: Terminal should propagate not handled shortcut key combo
data.body:
vscode: 1.9.0

When terminal is in focus, other shortcut keys such as `[Alt+p]` which invokes `project-manager` is not working.

It should propagate those so the extension can be triggered.

data.title: Adding support for compare 2 branches
data.body:
I think that vscode must have compare feature between 2 branches.

Version 1.9

data.title: Feature Request: Add VCS color for files in tree view and tabs
data.body: I know it is possible to see the new and modified files in the Git view but I think that can be great to have a setting to enable/disable VCS colors

data.title: Run ts server using ubuntu bash (WSL)
data.body:
It would be nice if ts server in VSCode could run using Ubuntu Bash (Windows Subsystem for Linux). It is needed if in general dev workflow assumes working with bash shell and WSL file system. For example, WSL symlinks are not compatible with windows NTFS symlinks - this makes running VSCode (tsserver) and other node_modules related operations in bash shell incompatible when linked modules are involved.

This issue is one of the cases of https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/10129

data.title: API Request: Support for "faded" code

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
This a request from the C# for VS Code extension to provide a way for a diagnostic to present itself as "faded" code. Note that this is orthogonal to the squiggle that appears. It's completely expected that a diagnostic could be "faded" while still appearing with a red, green, or no squiggle.

This is needed to support core editing experiences that we have in Visual Studio for code fixes like "Remove Unnecessary Usings", or "Remove Redundant Cast".

![fadedusingdirectives](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/116161/22749089/02c5964e-ede1-11e6-868e-8fe3c0134ff9.png)

cc @Eilon

data.title: [folding] Fold All at same level as cursor

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
When in a large file deeply nested, it is often unclear which fold level will match what you actually wish to fold.
Often, I want to collapse everything at the same level as my cursor.
In effect, this would select the fold level automatically based on current cursor position.

data.title: "Open Recent" selects an item out of the viewport after filtering
data.body:
- I have a ton of stuff in my recent history
- I type to filter the list, and it narrows down
- I press the arrow keys to select something and realize that the first selected item is not visible, so the view jumps to somewhere else

I can help debug if you can't repro it. Sometimes it works more as expected, sometimes not.

What determines which item is selected, when it's not the first one? It seems related to which one was more recently selected, and if I flip through a few windows, then I'll see it selecting a different one. But it often is selecting things that I haven't opened in a long time.
![feb-08-2017 08-58-00](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/323878/22747746/bf01f708-eddc-11e6-800e-aee018140210.gif)

Steps to Reproduce:

1. for code

```
<script src="https://www.gstatic.com/firebasejs/3.6.9/firebase.js"></script>
<script>
  // Initialize Firebase
  var config = {
    apiKey: "A",
    authDomain: "ren",
    databaseURL: "https://renxin-a35b4.firebaseio.com",
    storageBucket: "ren",

</script>

2. select format document

3. you will get

  <script src="https://www.gstatic.com/firebasejs/3.6.9/firebase.js"></script>
  <script>
    // Initialize Fireb    e
  var config           apiKey: "          authDomain: "re          databaseURL: "https://renxin-a35b4.firebaseio.co          storageBucket: "re          messagingSenderId: "547    "
     ;
  firebase.initializeApp(config);

  </script>
```

many chars are removed inside the script tag.

data.title: Add a openFilesInNewWindow setting that opens depending on being inside VS Code or not
data.body:
Before I get into this bug, thank you for adding this new setting for finer control over how files are opened with Code. Much appreciated!

- VSCode Version: 1.9.0
- OS Version: Win x64 10.0.14393

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Set the new `openFilesInNewWindow` setting to `"on"`
2. Activate an existing Code window and choose "File > Open" or "File > Open Recent" to open a file.

Whether the file is within the open/active folder in the Code window or not, the file is always opened in a new window. I don't find this behavior to be intuitive.

I believe "on" should mean that when I'm working in an **existing** Code window, any "open file" commands I issue **from that window** should result in the file(s) being opened in that same window.

If I take action **outside** any Code window (i.e. from Explorer or double-clicking on a file I've associated with Code (which is technically still Explorer I suppose)) to open the file(s), they should open in a **new** Code window.

As for `"default"` and `"off"`, these values work as I would expect them to so far.

(Note that the `ctrl+p` quick-open command is not affected and works as expected, opening files within the active window.)

data.title: keyboard shortcuts wonky with caps lock on
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 
Version 1.8.1
Commit ee428b0eead68bf0fb99ab5fdc4439be227b6281
Date 2016-12-19T14:41:20.664Z
Shell 1.4.6
Renderer 53.0.2785.143
Node 6.5.0

- OS Version: 

Linux ubuntu02 4.4.0-59-generic #80-Ubuntu SMP Fri Jan 6 17:47:47 UTC 2017 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux

Steps to Reproduce:

Save is mapped as ctrl+s
Save as is mapped as ctrl+shift+s

1. Put caps lock on
2. save file (ctrl+s)
3. observe save-as dialog (key combo is interpreted as ctrl+shift+s)

caps lock should not be used as a replacement for "shift"

data.title: Netwok: Folder appears empty when using a network drive

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
When using VS Code with a Samba network drive mounted on Z:, some folders appear as empty, even if though they have content. Opening one of the files in that folder from Windows Explorer into VS Code sometimes fixes the issue. 

- VSCode Version: 1.9.0
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Mount a Samba folder on Z:
2. Open the Z: folder in VS Code
3. Sometimes, some folders appear empty in VS Code Explorer; opening in VS Code, from Win Explorer, a file in that folder sometimes makes the correct folder structure to appear

data.title: IntelliSense requires ATA definitions instead of local module
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.9.0 (27240e71ef390bf2d66307e677c2a333cebf75af, 2017-02-02T08:31:00.827Z)
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Have automatic type acquisition enabled.
2. Write a file with the same name as any npm package (eg. `config`).
3. Require it in another module: `const config = require('./config')`, notice the `./` which should indicate I meant to require a local module.
4. IntelliSense will use the npm package typings instead of the local file.

![code_2017-02-08_15-28-23](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1371800/22741467/a2587320-ee13-11e6-939d-11f6ea203e08.png)

data.title: HTML formatting broken when tag is too long
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.9.0 (27240e71ef390bf2d66307e677c2a333cebf75af, 2017-02-02T08:31:00.827Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.14393
- Extensions:

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|angular-material-snippets|4tron|0.3.1|
|bracket-pair-colorizer|CoenraadS|0.2.1|
|vscode-svgviewer|cssho|1.3.1|
|githistory|donjayamanne|0.1.5|
|python|donjayamanne|0.5.8|
|EditorConfig|EditorConfig|0.3.4|
|tslint|eg2|0.8.1|
|vscode-npm-script|eg2|0.1.8|
|autofilename|JerryHong|0.1.3|
|docthis|joelday|0.3.10|
|Angular2|johnpapa|1.0.2|
|code-beautifier|michelemelluso|1.6.2|
|csharp|ms-vscode|1.6.2|
|debugger-for-chrome|msjsdiag|2.5.2|
|java|redhat|0.0.9|
|vscode-icons|robertohuertasm|7.2.0|
|partial-diff|ryu1kn|0.2.0|
|vscode-sql-beautify|sensourceinc|0.0.4|
|autoimport|steoates|1.2.2|
|code-spell-checker|streetsidesoftware|0.17.2|
|local-history|xyz|1.1.0|
|html-css-class-completion|Zignd|1.0.3|

---

When trying to format an html file with html tags that spread accross two or more lines, the closing html tag stays at the same level of the content and doesn't go back. 
Example:

Expected:

```html
<md-autocomplete ng-if="$ctrl.parentSelect" flex md-selected-item="$ctrl.parent" md-selected-item-change="$ctrl.selectParent(item)"
    md-search-text="$ctrl.searchText" md-items="item in $ctrl.getResources($ctrl.searchText)" md-item-text="item.title" md-min-length="2"
    md-floating-label="Parent">
.......
</md-autocomplete>
```

After formatting with vscode:

```html
<md-autocomplete ng-if="$ctrl.parentSelect" flex md-selected-item="$ctrl.parent" md-selected-item-change="$ctrl.selectParent(item)"
    md-search-text="$ctrl.searchText" md-items="item in $ctrl.getResources($ctrl.searchText)" md-item-text="item.title" md-min-length="2"
    md-floating-label="Parent">
    .......
    </md-autocomplete>
```

|javadebugger|donjayamanne|0.0.2|

|php-debug|felixfbecker|1.10.0|
|Theme-tonic|gerane|0.0.2|
|CppSnippets|hars|0.0.6|

|vscode-clang|mitaki28|0.2.1|
|cpptools|ms-vscode|0.10.0|
|theme-quietlight-vsc|onecrayon|1.0.1|

---

Steps to Reproduce:

I love your new update very much which introduced a feature of Markdown but it has few problems. the problems which I have faced while writing CSS and HTML codes are:


1. While I was writing the tags like `<div>` it suddenly takes the tag (`<div>`) down, but the cursor is not taken along with it. Not only that, it even  deletes lines and I have to re -write it. 
 
~I want the cursor also to move along with the tags.


~~ I actually love this update and it adds it to my Best code editors list. hope you will add more Surprises in FUTURE.

-Thank You.

Please correct me wherever I am wrong Please.... :)

data.title: Automatic Type Acquisition doesn't work consistently
Hello world extension doesn`t work
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version:1.9
- OS Version:capitan mac os

Steps to Reproduce:

1. I followed the steps of [extensions of hello world](http://code.visualstudio.com/docs/extensions/example-hello-world),  press debugg icon. 
   However,  It didn`t work correctly . 
2.  ERROR NOTICE
     can`t  connect running process (reason:connect ETIMEOUT my ip address:32426)

my node.js  version is  6.9.5.   How to fix it.

data.title: Typing `<p` in markdown outputs unexpected preview text
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.9.0 - OS Version: Windows 10 Pro N 1607 (14393.693) Steps to Reproduce: 1. Open a new editor window with CTRL+N 2. Change Language Mode to Markdown 3. Markdown: Open Preview to the Side 4. Type `window.initialData = { source: "untitled%3A%2F%2FUntitled-2", line: 0, scrollPreviewWithEditorSelection: true, scrollEditorWithPreview: true, doubleClickToSwitchToEditor: true, }; Installed extensions: * christian-kohler.path-intellisense-1.2.0 (disabled) * dbaeumer.vscode-eslint-1.2.2 * eg2.tslint-0.8.1 * PeterJausovec.vscode-docker-0.0.11 * swyphcosmo.spellchecker-1.2.9 The following errors also appear in the console at the moment of typing `p`: 
webview.ts:94 [Embedded Page] Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'scrollEditorWithPreview' of undefined
webview.ts:94 [Embedded Page] Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'scrollPreviewWithEditorSelection' of undefined

data.title: Linting issue
data.body:
Hi,

I use babel-eslint 7.1.1. and I see syntax issue with the following piece in my JSX:

```
<button onClick={::this.handleLogin}>Log In</button>
```
It points at `::` and says that "expression expected"

My .eslintrc:

```
{
  "extends": [
    "eslint:recommended", 
    "plugin:react/recommended"
  ],
  "parser": "babel-eslint",
  "parserOptions": {
    "ecmaFeatures": {
      "jsx": true,
      "modules": true
    }
  },
  "plugins": [ "react" ], 
  "rules": {
    "indent": [ 2, 2 ],
    "quotes": [ 2, "single" ],
    "linebreak-style": [ 2, "unix" ],
    "semi": [ 2, "always" ],
    "no-console": [ 0 ],
    "no-loop-func": [ 0 ],
    "new-cap": [ 0 ],
    "no-trailing-spaces": [ 0 ],
    "no-param-reassign": [ 0 ],
    "func-names": [ 0 ],
    "comma-dangle": [ 0 ],
    "no-unused-expressions" : [ 0 ], // until fixed https://github.com/babel/babel-eslint/issues/158
    "block-scoped-var": [ 0 ], // until fixed https://github.com/eslint/eslint/issues/2253
    "react/prop-types": [ 0 ]
  },
  "env": {
    "es6": true,
    "node": true,
    "browser": true,
    "mocha": true
  }
}
```

ESLint works as expected and does not produce warnings:
>eslint --no-ignore scripts app test *.js
